blocks.text: Cloud vulnerabilities frequently result from misconfigured services rather than software defects. Publicly exposed storage buckets and overly permissive identity roles are common examples.
Cloud environments operate under shared responsibility models, where providers secure infrastructure but customers must secure configurations and data.
Lack of visibility can delay detection of cloud breaches, especially when logging is not properly configured.
Security posture management tools and automated configuration checks help reduce cloud misconfiguration risks.
